Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: These fucking people don't know what they don't know

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: actually how will a dusting attack against zaddr work?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the zaddr are not on chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only if you let your zaddr to be known can they send anything to it, but even then pretty sure they cannot see when you spend it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as sender of dust, they will know the txid that is their dust tx, but when it is spent, that txid is not referenced

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i do not see that what zcash says is 100% false, maybe there are some edge cases, but i dont even see those. once you send the funds, when it is spent, all you see is an encrypted blob, which looks like any other encrypted blob

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: unlike XMR, dusting zcash is really not effective at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically if zcash tech lets you see when a utxo you sent to someone else is spent again, well that wouldnt be very zero knowledge and it would be a severe flaw in privacy.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means you cant see when a utxo you send to someone else is being spent

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which makes dust attacks ineffective

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe "impervious" is too strong a word as i can see the possibility of some massive dust attack combined with side channel surveillance, like seeing that your CPU usage is different from other CPU when scanning the encrypted blobs. but that requires your CPU state to be externally known to the attacker. though in the post-heartbleed days this is not an unthinkable possibility

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c give me a zaddr of yours, and I will dust you?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Zcash people give out zaddrs freely

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c also, isn't the Sapling Woodchipper a dusting attack against all zaddrs of an entire chain at once?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "impervious" is a very very strong word

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c let's say I scrape all Zcash mining pools that support zaddr payouts (there are only a few), then I can dust attack all pool miners that use zaddrs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c let's say you only show me a txid

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: well, I will go look at your nullifier in the metadata not shown on the explorer

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and if you ever every do a z->t xtn, to your self, because you must, to shield/unshield newly mined funds/etc, I will know a taddr in your wallet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: And will just dust attack that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `which means you cant see when a utxo you send to someone else is being spent` - I am not sure I understand this logic

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I don't need to see that my target has spent any UTXOs I attack with

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: All the above works against attacking Pirate zaddrs, and Hush zaddrs too

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c unrelated, I was looking at main.cpp and see that `-maxmempool` and `-mempoolexpiry` CLI options were commented out. Was wondering why

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: The logic "because you don't know one of my zaddrs, Zcash is impervious" does not follow

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and this attack against LTC, this dust attack. I thought it was a DoS

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: what privacy do LTC user have to be taken?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I know that in the past, LTC has been hit with massive 1sat attacks. 50% of the LTC UTXO set is 1sat utxos, iirc

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: calling 1sat dust vs spam is very edge case, I agree that technically it's "spam" not "dust", according to BTC internal definition of "dust"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I think we need better terminology

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "deanonymization attacks" and "dust attacks" didn't have the same exact meaning to me, but I see that is how it's used

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am familiar with the de-anon stuff in XMR recently, and yes, Zcash doesn't have that exact problem

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Many coins won't allow spam, or under some sat value. Which means that "spam attacks" become "dust attacks"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: like on GAME, which has a huge min UTXO size

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c I guess I need to find the proper dank meme to clarify all this on twitter. It's an art, not a science

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with LTC, chainanalysis (my guess) is trying to link KYC info with LTC addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for all of the largest LTC addresses

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ah, so they are doing analysis on change addresses

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it tends to grab whatever utxos are in the wallet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: including the dust and maybe from a different address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the moment you sign a tx that has vins from two different addresses, BAM! they are linked

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yeah, BTC coin control has no user-visible knobs. It does really dumb stuff by default, regarding privacy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: over time, you might link all your wallet addresses, including the one you deposited to the exchange from

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: bingo! KYC now applies to all your wallet addresses with very high degree of accuracy

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: samaroui wallet claims to have some of the best coin control features around

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no need for any fancy analysis, just see where the dust got spent, look at all the other vin addresses, link them in the DB

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I will put forth that we need to differentiate between de-anonymizing dust attacks and DoS dust attacks (and both can be done at the same time)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c thanks for bringing up that I was using different words than the rest of the world. It happens, as a mathematician, more than you would think

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no problem, i try to point out technical errors when i see them, and sometimes (often?) the interpretation of words changes technical statements from valid <-> invalid

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: we are inventing new words and concepts constantly, so it's no surprise that there are misunderstandings about the meanings of things
